thread.title: Kate Middleton Shuts Down the BAFTAs In Custom Alexander McQueen
thread.title_full: Kate Middleton Shuts Down the BAFTAs In Custom Alexander McQueen

title: Kate Middleton Shuts Down the BAFTAs In Custom Alexander McQueen
text: Kate Middleton Shuts Down the BAFTAs In Custom Alexander McQueen February 12, 2017 11:28 PM by Maria Ward Photo: Getty Images For the Duchess of Cambridge, wearing custom Alexander McQueen is perhaps de rigueur, but Kate Middleton knows how to make it feel new. Lest we forget, Sarah Burton is a favorite of the young royal who wore the designer for her wedding to Prince William at Westminster Abbey, and several times since. Who could forget that fire- red-engine suit Middleton sported on multiple occasions, with—and without—the matching fascinator? And her latest turn in the designer at tonight’s British Academy Film Awards gave new meaning to the look of an elegant English Rose, right down to the whimsical floral motif. The delicate off-the-shoulder neckline offset the demure nature of her gown, showing off her toned shoulders. A black satin ribbon detail highlighted Middleton’s waist, while a full hem had an Old World influence that just got better at every swish of the skirt. A simple pair of sparkling drop earrings pulled the look together, for the head-turning effect that is the Duchess’s signature. In This Story: Kate Middleton , BAFTA Recommended For You
